Product Name: CNPGD All-in-1 Smartwatch+GSM Watch Cell Phone, with FM, MP3/4, Voice recorder (Pink)
Reviews: Update: 4-6-2016TL;DR: Upgrading to 5 stars. This is a great watch for the money. CNPGD did a great job once again. If you want a sharp looking round-face design smart watch on the cheap, then this is a very solid build with excellent screen and feature set. You might need a different app for Android 5.0+ than what it comes with. Dig below for the app description.UPDATE: Take the time to install the right app. There is no way this is a 2 star smart watch unless you are expecting it to have a feature set other than what it actually is: a smart watch. It's not a phone watch, it's not a hybrid calling watch, it's just a fantastic little smart watch.By request - ALL the details:This watch has a lot going for it, with a couple of nit-picky cons. Let's start out with my device specs: UPDATE: Phone switch to - Digital Reign Journey Phablet with Android KitKat. Keep this in mind during the following information regarding the app, etc.# First thing is ... the mobile app that goes with the watch. It has a QR code built into the watch. Scan it and grab the app. Very nice looking app. I found one I like even better called "TRULY SmartDevice" - it is nearly identical in appearance and functionality, plus it works perfectly with the watch using my phone/tablet. If the scanned app doesn't work for you, go grab the one I mentioned and you will be all set. 100% all notifications push for the Android. I do not own Apple products to test for you sorry. Also, this app has a 'scan' feature. If you have trouble using in combo with a headset, just check on Scan, and choose your watch. Probably got switched to your headset when it connected. Done.UPDATE: TRULY SmartDevice app allows the install of weather applet. Works great. Wish there were more applets!# Construction of this watch is top notch. Metal housing, plastic back and face/screen, and magnetic charger make this look and feel first rate. Lots of compliments in the first two days of wear. Not a flawed bevel or 'squeezable' creaky seam to be found.UPDATE: I have really put this poor thing through its paces lately and it has stood up to some real abuse. Heavy rain, got beaten against a door frame several times hauling equipment around, wasn't paying attention scrubbing up and completely doused it in the sink (at which point it powered off by itself and I thought I had fried it! Dried it off and it has worked ever since.), etc. Still works like a champ.# Bluetooth connectivity is great. What's that mean? I mean it is solid. Stable. Great range. Freaky range actually. I have a PLT_Legend Headset which has amazing range, and I will hear 'beep... phone 1 disconnected' right before I start feeling my wrist vibrate to warn me it is losing signal. Works great with headsets by the way.# Charged this on the first day in about 1.5 hours from 'low battery' warning to full charge. I have been playing around with it quite a bit, playing music, taking and making calls with it for fun, and I get a LOT of messages, emails, skype, case notifications via specialized apps, etc. as a contractor just in regular use.UPDATE: I am changing this to an average of 3 days. You will get anywhere from 2 to 4+ days depending on how much it gets used. Really, it is up to you how much life you get out of it, but either way - you'll never have to worry about battery life. It's incredible.# No battery draining extras. This is what it is: A Smart Watch. No SIM card slot, No TF slot, nothing. Just give you notifications and has a few nice apps like Pedometer and such that seem to work ok. I've tested it all (aside from 'Siri' since I don't own Apple stoofs) and it all appears to work as it should.# Sound is simply fantastic. If CNPGD is good at anything - this seems to be it. Louder than any name brand watch I've messed with, crystal clear, and music reproduction is pretty amazing. Outright enjoyable to listen to in fact. Microphone works well according to the several people I tested it with.# The wristband is very nice quality. The underside is an almost suede texture making it very comfortable to wear, but read on to see one nit-pick that you should know about below.-> Lastly, there are a couple of things you should know before buying just in case any of these might be a deal breaker for you:# If you have large wrists, you will have to buy a longer wristband. I have what I would consider medium to even smallish wrists for a man. I am using the *last* hole on the band and I mean it is exactly comfortable. Any shorter and I wouldn't be able to wear it.UPDATE: Most moto360 bands can be modified to use with this. Leather bands are super easy to just widen the gap a bit. Metal bands are pretty simple to just use band itself and set pins - most of the link gaps are wide enough.# If you are partial to a digital display (i.e. large numbers displayed like 12:15 PM instead of an analog clock) then this will not work for you. There are 5 different watch faces, all of them are nice in their own way and a couple of them are downright amazing. However I am surprised there is no 'digital watch' option for viewing the time. Keep this in mind when ordering.UPDATE: This remains my only gripe, although it is not an issue since a couple of the faces I really like as it is.Overall, I am really enjoying this watch so far and will give regular updates as time goes on just as I did with my previous CNPGD watch. I will miss it dearly as it served me without fail for over a year's brutal abuse by my person. It's final accidental crunch under my foot gives way to this new adventure.UPDATE: So far this watch is every bit the gem my previous model was. I'm really on board with CNPGD products at this point. Bang for your buck, this is hard to beat.

Reviews: The phone delivered to me is a Samsung phone, but cannot be activated by Verizon. I ordered and paid for the phone because I needed a "NO CONTRACT VERIZON PHONE" to replace one my mother-in law broke. She is currently on my Verizon account, and I am currently under contract with Verizon. The model number and ESN tag on the phone Global Distributing sent me is obviously not the original tag, and has been replaced at some point in time. Regardless Verizon cannot activate phone, and says the tag on phone actually identifies it to be a Motorola phone.I have tried repeatedly and futilely to contact Global Distributing at (208) 391-5347 (phone number is number published under seller's information, and is also number given to me by Amazon's customer service). I have tried for 5 days to contact Global Distributing, and have left several specific voice messages on their Google phone service. I have yet to receive the courtesy of a return phone call from anybody other than Amazon customer service.After involving Amazon customer service (best most responsive customer service I have ever dealt with), and receiving refund from Amazon I finally received an email from Global Distributing whinging about refuns.Global Distributing needs not to whine to Amazon about refunds, but needs to do the right and proper thing by contacting customers, returning phone calls, and selling proper products. No refund was requested by me, but was the last resort since Global Distributing refused to return my phone calls. I ordered and paid for this phone on April 6, 2013. It has been 10+ days, and I am no closer to having replacement phone in hand. I am disappointed in the response by Global Distributing. They need to treat their customers like customers.

Product Name: Sony Xperia Z3 Compact D5803 16GB 4G LTE 4.6" Unlocked GSM Android Smartphone - Black - International Version No Warranty
Reviews: I just received this phone in the mail yesterday and my initial impressions are extremely positive. Although Apple gets a lot of my business (I own a Mac Mini, Macbook Air, iPod and iPad), when it comes to phones, I've always preferred Android, namely Samsung. This is my first Sony phone product and I have to say this is an awesome phone. I'll post an update later after I've had a chance to use the phone some, but, based on first impressions, I'll say that if you don't want an iPhone but still want to buy a high-end smartphone, then look no further than the Xperia Z3 Compact or perhaps the full-size Xperia Z3. Personally, I don't want to carry around a large phablet, and the Z3 Compact's 4.6 inch screen, which is close to the iPhone 6 screen in size, is sufficient for me. Not to mention I have small hands, and this is much comfortable for me to hold than a larger phone.Software-wise, I am discovering that Sony has paid a lot of attention to detail. When I initially plugged the phone into the USB port on my MB Air, my phone screen immediately displayed a prompt to install Sony Bridge transfer software on the phone and also on my computer. It took only a minute or so to install the software and after I launched it, I was presented with an interface that gave me links to all my media (music, photos, etc..), as well as my iTunes playlists and the option to select and sync the items I wanted to the external SD card on my phone. I selected all the music I wanted and hit the sync button on Sony Bridge on my computer and away it went and once done my music will show up in the very nice Sony Walkman app pre-installed on the phone. With my old Samsung S4 Mini, the built-in music player is not as full-featured and I couldn't sync my playlists. I had to rely on a third-party app, Air Sync to do that, and while it worked well enough, I had to do the sync wirelessly, and there were a few songs that Air Sync couldn't copy over from iTunes for various reasons, and also it was very time consuming to sync over wifi since I have a lot of music. I'm a bit old-fashioned in that I prefer connecting my mp3 players directly to my computer to sync my files.Build-quality of the Z3 Compact is excellent. It looks and feels like a premium quality phone.Anyway, those are my initial impressions. I'll come back in a month or so after I've had more time to play with the phone and list all the pros and possible cons that I find.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy J2 J200M 8GB - Factory Unlocked Phone - Retail Packaging - Black
Reviews: This Samsung J2 phone was made in Argentina. If you are in the United States, you cannot register a J2 phone on your account on Samsung.com. This is Amazon.com, so this may be important for US residents. This phone has a Region Lock. It says to call anywhere for 5+ minutes to unlock the Region Lock. I am on my way to Europe, so this is a very annoying needless step, that cost me $20 to get a SIM and Minutes. The phone works in the US. Android works. BUT, in the US, we consumers demand transparency. Opening the box, and having the flyer fall out with the "Region Lock" info, was frightening. Not being able to register the product on Samsung.com means 1) I can't register it, and 2) obtaining "warranty" service might be non-existent, according to the US Samsung call center representative. At that point, the $138 might mean I bought a "disposable" phone.Update May 9 2016: I did use the phone service in the US for the required 5+ minutes in order to meet the requirements of the Region Lock. I'm now in Europe and have Vodaphone voice and data service, both of which work as expected.

Product Name: Nokia C3-00 Unlocked Cell Phone with QWERTY, Dedicated E-mail Key, 2 MP Camera, Media Player, WLAN, and MicroSD Slot--International Version with Warranty (Black)
Reviews: It's #1 feature in my opinion is battery life. I have left the phone on with bluetooth connectivity on and it has been 5 1/2 days on one charge with light phone and internet, I am down to one green bar on the battery but the thing still hasn't given me a low battery warning. Battery life is awesome.I use t-mobile and since I have wifi at home and work I don't need a data plan. I do have the $1.99 per MB of data service on my plan and if you have that then the phone will use tiny amounts of data to give you email alerts. After 5 days of being always on it has used 0.2 MB so I am looking at $2 or $4 a month for email alerts.The operating system is very primitive but the calendar (that syncs with outlook, but a USB cable is required, no wifi sync) and email (I use multiple accounts with gmail no problem) are both good. I got an 8 gb memory card so I could use it as an mp3 player. The thing in the middle looks like a track pad in the picture but it's just an up/down/left/right switch. There is no gps and really no useful apps to download for it. It does let you check facebook alerts easily if you are in to that but I used the space to always display the current date.If you want a phone with incredibly awesome battery life that lets you check your email, carry your schedule, and doesn't lock you in to an expensive plan for two years then this is the phone to get.

Product Name: Nokia 5800 XpressMusic Unlocked Phone with U.S. 3G, GPS with Free Voice Navigation, Wi-Fi, and 4 GB MicroSD Card--U.S. Version with Warranty (Black)
Reviews: I guess like most thing, this phone started out being a rock star! I loved the way it looked. I loved the sound and quality of the music and the ease of use between my PC and the phone itself. It came loaded with easy to use software. Not to mention, its kind of cool having a phone that is light years ahead of anything they even have in the AT&T store. I have always been a PDA kind of guy until this phone. This time, I wanted a little more fun phone. Something that was more music but, could handle my on the road demands of email and internet surfing. This phone did all of that...UNTIL! About eight months of having, I started to notice little thing. Like, it kept powering off with the lightest touch. This got so bad, I had to put a little piece of paper between the battery and the case to press it into place. Then, for about a month, I could not SEND text! I could get them, I could send email, I could send pic's, I could not send text. I am not hating on Nokia at all, I am just a little concerned. Would I not recommend Nokia, NO. They make great stuff. I just want people to know little things I have run across since I have had mine. I am very close to picking up the N97 now so, I am not done with them...although I will make sure the service contract is IRON CLAD this time!

Reviews: BEWARE!!! Users who want software updates do NOT buy this product.I receive the Go Phone version of the Lumia 635 with SKU S561A, which for some unknown reason AT&T is not allowing to receive the latest software update. The update has been out for store bought Lumia 635s with SKU S561 for over a month now, but in spite of both versions having identical hardware, nobody with the Go Phone version is able to update.This not only means that I cannot get the latest Windows Phone 8.1 update, which has a number of large improvements, but I will also not be able to get the Windows Phone 10 update when that comes out, as you must have the latest 8.1 update for it to work.If I wanted the Go Phone version of this I would have gotten it at Walmart for $15 cheaper.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy S5 Mini G800F 16GB 4G LTE Unlocked GSM Android Quad-Core Smartphone - Blue
Reviews: Update, April 2016:I should have updated months ago, but basically within 2015 (less than a year since purchase) the phone slowed down a good bit. At the moment, in April 2016, I still have it but it's much slower still. It seems to stall for a few seconds when doing simple things -- touching any icon to launch an app, trying to snap a pic, trying to enter a web address or search item into the browser search field (the keyboard takes several seconds to come up). It's unfair they seem to go noticeably wonky after just a few months of use, especially after the price paid. The camera issues started in under 6 months.I've removed one star because I don't think these phones should degrade so quickly with controlled to moderate use.--Quad core is the way to go. This thing moves fast! The touch sensitivity is very good, apps and internet function smoothly and very quickly (internet might depend on your mobile data service, or wifi quality). And I can attest, from personal experience, that the water-resistant feature WORKS WELL! -- I had a bit of an accident, where the phone was in water for a few seconds, but was back to normal after drying. The speaker took a few days to start working as it did (sounded scratchy because it needed more drying time), but after that, it was back to perfect. Purchased around Dec 2014.

Product Name: BLU Energy X Plus Smartphone - With 4000 mAh Super Battery- US GSM Unlocked - Silver
Reviews: First off, the deal on this phone is absolutely incredible especially for someone who has used go phones in the past. Now for the actual review. I have had this phone for about a week now and I have very very very few complaints. This is especially impressive considering the fact that I only dropped $119 dollars including tax on a smartphone. What BLU is doing, taking flagship technology and putting it in affordable smartphones, is brilliant! The thing I love the most about this phone though, is the gigantic battery that fits inside this device, and the phone is still incredibly thin. The operating system is snappy, the camera is good qualitly, and it has a front facing flash which is always a plus. My first minor complaint is that I wish the phone was LTE compatible. This isn't that big of a deal because you are paying such a low price for the device, it doesn't really matter. Plus, the phone is capable of using dual sims which would compensate for the lack of speed if you were really that worked about it. Regardless, the 4G is relatively fast on the phone. However, I have noticed the intena on this device is not quite as sensitive as it was on my old phone and has a hard time picking up service in low service areas. Thats really it for major complaints. I was bumbed that Snapchat didn't work on the device, but oh well. Probably best I don't become addicted to my phone anyways. Nonetheless, I would definitely recommend this phone. It is an excellent device and works just as good as any tier 1 one phone like iPhone 6 or galaxy s5. But you are only paying a fraction of the price for this phone. Well worth the buy!

Product Name: BLU Life XL - LTE Smartphone - GSM Unlocked - 16GB +2GB RAM - White
Reviews: After using this phone for a couple of weeks I raised my rating from three to four stars, basically because I found a bunch of workarounds. Overall, this is a good - even very good - phone for the price, depending what you want to do with it. Just make sure you order the 16/2 not the 8/1 memory configuration. It's only ten bucks more but twice the memory, duh.So here are some workarounds:(1) poor documentation. If you've handled smart phones all your life you won't care about this, if not ask your closest teenage relative.(2) very poor audio from the speaker - it is mono, and you can't hear it no matter how high you crank the volume. The earbuds suck too. My workaround was to get a cheap but totally different pair of buds that actually fit ok inside my ears.(3) camera is pretty good for casual photos outdoors in sunlight, if you (3a) peel off the plastic layer [undocumented] on the lens cover, and (3b) set the shutter delay = 1 or 2 sec, to avoid camera shake. Camera sucks in low light, and there is no optical zoom. If you are taking museum or long-lens photos I would seriously not recommend it, otherwise you may be happy.(4) JPG Photos straight from the camera are _not_ compatible with Photoshop 5.0 LE (get a segment length error). You have to "export" them first in the BLU photo editor. Which is very annoying to do one photo at a time. (5) Comes preloaded with about two dozen worthless apps.I know that's a lot of negatives, but the positive is the price and, well, the price. It's not like this phone screwed me or anything. If you don't like the negatives, then buy an i-phone for 8x as much.

I cannot talk enough about how user-friendly everything is.Sadly, I have been experiencing some problems with gestures (the on-escreen swiping) this past few weeks. It has been so bad that I can hardly use my Pre, and am looking for a cheap replacement to tide me over until I am able to get a more solid phone. For things to go this wrong in such a short time is unacceptable!I am going to try and get the Palm Pre 3 next. That is how much I believe in WebOS. Since I live in Africa (Mozambique), I don't know how long it will be for someone to come down from the U.S with it.

Product Name: BLU Life One Unlocked Dual Sim Phone L120, 16 GB, White
Reviews: Just got my phone last week and am already loving it. It came brand new in a sealed plastic case along with a silicone case, earbuds, charger and screen protector. The screen size and resolution are impressive. It has tons of great features like Google Now and gestures but it's not loaded with a bunch of apps that I won't ever use. I purchased a 32G memory card but it hasn't arrived yet. They recommend that you store all pictures and data on a memory card so that the internal memory can be used for apps.I have Consumer Cellular as a carrier so I just popped in my sim card and the phone and GPS worked great right away. I had to call for help to set up mobile data though. The tech at Consumer Cellular had never heard of this phone and they didn't have a protocol in their system for it but I told him that it was almost identical to the Galaxy S4 and those settings ended up working perfectly.I compared this phone to a coworker's Galaxy and there really are no visible differences. He was seriously impressed and is looking into switching plans as soon as his contract expires. Just FYI, my husband and I pay $70 (including taxes) a month for two phones with 1000 shared minutes, unlimited texts and 500MG data. We have wifi at home and at work so that is totally sufficient for us. So happy this phone worked out! I'd highly recommend it.

Product Name: Moto G Plus (4th Gen.) Unlocked - White - 16GB - U.S. Warranty

Product Name: Nokia Lumia 820 8GB GSM 4G LTE Windows 8 Smartphone - Black - AT&T - No Warranty
Reviews: I am loving my new phone. After much searching, reading reviews and comparison shopping I am glad to end up with the Nokia 820. It generally got good reviews and has not disappointed me in any way after a couple of weeks of use. The one thing the reviews made me worry about was that moving up to this full sized smartphone would seemed like I would be carrying a huge brick, I have found that the Nokia 820 phone fits nicely in my front pocket (I am a blue jeans wearing male) and although it is a little bit heavy in the hand it feels very sturdy and well built and doesn't seem like a burden in the pocket.Naturally I have not completely figured out all of the features of my new phone but I have done my best to get to the ones I anticipate using most often. Music, photos and productivity software all works great on the Nokia. The hardware for taking photos have produced really nice images in a variety of settings and lighting conditions. I haven't printed them out yet but they look good on my desktop screen even when I zoom in on small portions of the picture. The music plays nicely on my headphones and the speaker is acceptable but a little quiet. The loud speaker plays best when placed on a hard surface but if you really want to listen without headphones I recommend getting some external speakers. The music apps preloaded worked great and everything was instantly responsive.This is my first full feature smartphone and so I was not tied into any of the OS ecosystems that are out there. Since I use Microsoft Windows in my work setting it was a relatively easy thing to learn the Windows phone layout. In fact learning new things about my phone has actually increased the usefulness of my home and work computers as I starting syncing more and more of my data across devices. From the productivity standpoint I am now totally sold on the usefulness of this smartphone. I regularly use my e-mail, OneNote and Skydrive accounts throughout my day and have found that the phone seamlessly keeps everything up to date.Speaking of Apps...now I understand why people make such a big deal about the limits of the Windows app store. It isn't like there aren't a ton of apps to choose from but often you start with a web page that you use a lot and then get the mobile app. If that app isn't supported you could go out and find something similar but it just isn't the same. You often have invested time and energy in the original web site and so it feels like a loss to start over with a different app. I don't think this will be a big deal with me but I can see it frustrating people who are more tied to their apps. The phone works great with the apps it has available but you might look to see if your favorite cookbook, movie streaming service or bird app is available for Windows phone if you are choosing which OS you want to live with.Finally and probably most importantly for the supplier of my phone, I would highly recommend purchasing through these guys. They shipped my phone incredibly quickly and provided the exact product described. The unlocked phone naturally comes from overseas and they sent a plug adapter along with it so it was immediately functional. (Quick note: even though my phone was marked for sale in Saudi Arabia, absolutely everything works in good 'ol American English and all the standard apps and features were present from the moment I turned it on.) I had a some questions about the phone and the suppliers replied within half a day if not faster - even on the weekend!

Product Name: Nokia C3-00 Unlocked Cell Phone (Slate) with QWERTY, Dedicated E-mail Key, 2 MP Camera, Media Player, WLAN, and MicroSD Slot
Reviews: It's #1 feature in my opinion is battery life. I have left the phone on with bluetooth connectivity on and it has been 5 1/2 days on one charge with light phone and internet, I am down to one green bar on the battery but the thing still hasn't given me a low battery warning. Battery life is awesome.I use t-mobile and since I have wifi at home and work I don't need a data plan. I do have the $1.99 per MB of data service on my plan and if you have that then the phone will use tiny amounts of data to give you email alerts. After 5 days of being always on it has used 0.2 MB so I am looking at $2 or $4 a month for email alerts.The operating system is very primitive but the calendar (that syncs with outlook, but a USB cable is required, no wifi sync) and email (I use multiple accounts with gmail no problem) are both good. I got an 8 gb memory card so I could use it as an mp3 player. The thing in the middle looks like a track pad in the picture but it's just an up/down/left/right switch. There is no gps and really no useful apps to download for it. It does let you check facebook alerts easily if you are in to that but I used the space to always display the current date.If you want a phone with incredibly awesome battery life that lets you check your email, carry your schedule, and doesn't lock you in to an expensive plan for two years then this is the phone to get.

Product Name: Sony Xperia Z5 Unlocked Phone - Retail Packaging - Gold
Reviews: I'm a big gamer, and I don't need to go over those features for you for the thousandth time, but after deciding not to upgrade to the Sony Xperia Z3 or Z3+ due to the heating issues, and a couple other reasons, I drooled over the Xperia Z5 specs for months waiting to buy this phone in the U.S. with a warranty. I finally got it through Amazon, and this phone is absolutely blazing fast! However the number the Sony Guy provided me to purchase an additional warranty didn't pan out, I still feel this phone deserves a full 5 star review. The camera, the graphics, the power, The playstation integration for gamers, this phone is exactly what I have been waiting for to upgrade for my trusty Xperia Play R800 and I couldn't be happier. Unless of course it slid out into a PlayStation controller like the old R800's but the display, camera, and about everything else make this phone so vastly superior in every aspect. I'm not even mad the U.S. version didn't get a finger print scanner as there is a ton of apps for that, and that wasn't a selling point anyways for me. I am in love all over again with another great Xperia!

Also, if you don't remove the plastic screen protector that comes on it in the box, it will disrupt your ear proximity sensor.Some things you'll have to check if you want full functionality of your phone will be your SMS service center number, APN access point network for Internet and Lte to work, network settings in general. Product Name: Sony Xperia Z5 Unlocked Phone - Retail Packaging - Gold
Reviews: Coming from a Galaxy S3 (with Zerolemon extended battery) that lasted 3+ years, the difference between the two phones is night and day. Definitely larger, less curvy, and thinner. The Z5 feels very premium if not a little on the fragile side. I've heard reports in the past (especially with the Z3) of the screens self-cracking, so I wasn't going to take any chances with this phone. I also ordered a tempered glass screen protector and a clear TPU case and threw those on before anything else.It's only been a few days, and these are my observations thus far:Spent the first two days playing with the Z5 and updating it. An update was available right out of the box. This can be done either through the phone itself or by connecting it to the computer and installing Sony's Xperia Companion software (which I didn't mind.) There were a lot of features to play with. Won't be getting bored any time soon. One thing to note: the volume buttons are on the lower-right side of the phone, as opposed to the Galaxy S3's upper-left side. It takes some getting used to. Some have said that it's simply poor placement, but it's really not that bad. It might be annoying if you're right-handed, but I could see left-handers having an easier time. It's left-hander friendly! And for the record, I could care less about the lack of fingerprint scanner support. I don't think it's a needed feature, and definitely not a deal-breaker. My S3 didn't have one, so I don't believe I'm missing out.Today was my first real day of having it in my pocket while at work. I don't wear tight pants, but the phone is thinner than what I'm used to, so I remained aware of the potential of it bending in my pocket. I charged the phone overnight to 100%. As of this writing (around 4:13 PM), I'm down to 76%. Granted, I wasn't using the camera heavily or playing any games yet or had the screen on for a prolonged period of time. But as it stands, I can easily get two days out of this thing.Here's something of interest: I guess Android 6.0 has a feature called "Double-tap to Wake", where you can simply double-tap the display and it'll come on so you can unlock the device from there. Very nice feature! I always think that I'm wearing down the power button with the constant screen turning on and off. BUT, over the course of the work day and having the phone in my pocket, I noticed on two occasions that the flashlight mode was shining in my pocket. Somehow, it enabled itself in my pocket and I know I locked the device. I also noticed that my bluetooth was on, and I had no recollection of turning that on as well. I suspect that the "Double-tap to Wake" feature is so sensitive that it's turning on in my pocket, sliding around, and sliding the notification bar down and pressing random settings off and on. Even in my pocket, the screen must be very sensitive! There's apparently a "Glove mode" that makes it easier to interact with the screen while wearing gloves. This mode was turned off. I've since turned off the "Double-tap to Wake" feature. I'll report back if I'm still having issues with this.

Product Name: Nokia Lumia 920 32GB Unlocked GSM 4G LTE Windows 8 Smartphone - Red
Reviews: I've been wanting this Windows phone since its release and have finally plop down the money for one. First of all, the type: Nokia Lumia 920 unlocked white International version (RM-821). The biggest difference between international version RM-821 and AT&T's RM-820 is that AT&T's RM-820 is locked (need to get unlock code from AT&T) and AT&T's version support AT&T's 4G network. Since I use this with pay as you go on AT&T network, I usually turn the data OFF unless I really need it (rare). My RM-821 does see AT&T 3G, AT&T LTE 1 Lumia and AT&T LTE 2 Lumia. The biggest advantage of RM-821 over AT&T's branded version is ... whatever updates Nokia/Microsoft announces, you get immediately instead of waiting for AT&T to get theirs. eg. I got the GDR2/Amber update way before official AT&T version get theirs.The phone itself:Beautiful. The screen is bright, the back side is shiny, and it holds nicely in my hand. 32 GB of memory means I'm not fighting for space between my music, photos, videos and apps. It's a bit heavy/big (according to my wife) but I love the weight and size (4.5") comparing to my previous (Nokia 710 : Windows Phone 7.8) I was debating if I want to pay an extra $100 bucks for the 925 or $800 bucks for the unlocked 1020. The 1020 looks awesome but $800 bucks unlocked (or $609 on AT&T) is a bit steep. 925 looks nice but 16GB RAM is a deal breaker. Most Amazon vendor sells Lumia 920 for about $350 - $360. I've also thought about the 820, which has micro SD slot but with a lower end camera, display and 8GB RAM, the 920 is worthy of their price.The camera:This is one of the main reason I got this phone: the PureView technology 8.7MP is awesome in low light! Go try it at a retail store that has it on display and you'll know what I mean. GDR2 update brings Nokia Pro Cam into the mix, allowing you to quickly mess with ISO, white balance, shutter speed, manual focus, and exposure compensation if you wish. Love the slide to zoom option (even in video!). The location of the camera is a bit too toward the middle since my finger sometimes gets in the way; I guess I just need to hold it the right way :pProcessor:Feels pretty snappy since it was the flag ship phone. Lumia 925/928/1020 all uses the same processor.Wireless charging:I haven't had the chance to play with this so you'll have to read other people's review for that one.NFC:I was looking forward to this since most Android phones can share photos via NFC. I've tried it with a Nexus 7 and no dice. I looked online and noticed that Android's implementation is different than Windows 8 ... so the sharing of photos/video is only possible Nokia to Nokia and Android to Android. You CAN, how ever share URLs and contacts (remember to do the share, choose tab+send)Maps:Offline maps is one of the reason I love this phone (Nokia in general) since you can download the map ahead of time and not worry about having data access to use the GPS option.Apps:Windows store may not have as many apps as iOS or Android, it has enough for me. There are only so many apps one can consume before you see variations of an idea. If it's a concern for you, go search the Windows Phone Store for apps before you buy a Windows phone.Sync:Yeah. People complained about this online because Microsoft is moving away from Zune for Desktop. To get your stuff synced between your PC and your phone, I use Zune to organize the music/video/photo/playlist and "Windows Phone app for Desktop" to do the syncing. It's clumsy but it works for me.Update on Sync: (10/18/2013)The playlist still messes up from time to time. One thing that works is: once you connect your phone, it's treated like a USB thumb drive device. To muck with the play list (correctly):1. have "Windows Phone app for Desktop" sync the music you want2. use File browser to navigate to whatever-you-name-your-phone\Phone\Music\Playlist (you need to enable "Show Hidden files, folders, and drives" if you stay with Microsoft defaults)3. right click on a playlist (something you need to create in Zune) and choose "Properties"4. Click on the "References tab" and it will show you the songs in the playlist5. To add songs, drag existing songs on your phone to the playlistOver all, it's a solid phone, I've grown to like Windows tiles and apps are on the increase.

Product Name: BLU Life 8 XL Smartphone - Unlocked - Global GSM - Pink
Reviews: Just got the new Blu Life 8 XL phone today in pink. It's a great phone for the price. Very large 5.5" screen, and somewhat thin. It is a little awkward in the hand due to the gargantuan size. The display could be a lot better. It isn't too bright, and the colors do not really pop out - but, better than most phones at the price range. The phone does operate a little slow as it operates off 3G, and even though it advertises that it can be upgraded to Android Lollipop, I did not see that as being available on the phone. But for the price, this phone blows others in this same range out of the water. I did notice I was missing a few things in my box - a detailed instruction manual, and the cord that connects to the plug in power adapter...but, luckily for me, I my adapter from my old phone fits this one, and the phone itself is pretty simple to get the hang of. I wish there were some phone cases for this. The phone did come with a phone case, but it isn't one that will really protect the phone in case I drop it. I have looked all over for a phone case, and there is not much of a selection. My recommendation for Blu is to come out with some cool phone cases like Otter boxes! Other than that, this phone is pretty cool.

Reviews: Edit , this phone has grown on me , while some lag issues remain , the screen feel really nice now maybe the latest update did something to the color production ,though not as vibrant in normal state the colors feel really true and beautiful if watching video ! It is light and good build i am really liking it now .I have had this phone for a few wees now and here are my imprressions ;Pros ; -- Build quality ;while not metal it feels nice and grippy in hand and is very light- the camera is good- Price ,i got iit for $240 and for the price it is a good valueCons ;- the biggest problem this phone has is the battery life ,my HTC M8 eve after 18 mths lssted the whole day but this phone barely oes till 5 pm with mordeerate to mild use , i need to keep charging it a lot and on top i cant use any of my old charging cables ..it is an annoyance- the other problem is the screen ,not sure how to describe it but it is very dull ,when i switched i noticed it a lot more now not so much but it is still not vibrant at all- there is some lag not too much to bother me but still noticeableIt is a decent phone especially given the price but battery life is an issue and a better screen would have been nice

Product Name: Studio 7.0 LTE - Smartphone - GSM Unlocked - White
Reviews: for the price it cannot be beat! it is totally unlocked so it can be used worldwide with ANY gsm provider and it is 7 inch and it is LTE and it runs lollipop as well. i challenge anyone to show me a phone that is seven inch and unlocked and LTE with lollipop for anywhere NEAR this price. there is however one issue i have with the phone: the battery is NOT removable. that means when you run out of battery power during the day you are finished! P.S. it is EXTREMELY difficult/tricky to insert and remove the sim card. so much so that they actually furnish you a "tool" that you have to use to open the latch so that you can insert and remove the sim card.from the sim card tray.. still and all....for the price it cannot be beat.

Plugging in the charger a screen with an empty battery and a lightening bolt show, no charging, won't fire up, nothing, so basically dead after a few minutes use. It's a cute phone but never charged correctly even new. I'd pass on it.

Product Name: Samsung Wireless Charger Pad, International Version for Samsung Galaxy S7 / S7 Edge - Black
Reviews: 5 starts as it does everything it said it would. This is an official Samsung product, so i expected some level of quslity, and was not disappointed. This particular order did not come with the cable to plug it into an outlet (which i knew, but wanted to make sure anyone else interested in this product knows). Any micro-usb plug in seems to have worked for me so far. Keep in mind this was not advertised, nor did it claim to be (and nor is it), a fast-charge device. So if you're accustomed to the fast-charge cable that comes with the S7 edge (as is my phone), it does not charge that quickly. Also, worth pointing out for people who may not be aware, the S7 edge, and preceeding models, have a small area within where the wireless charging connects to the phone. Took me a little bit of time to find that swert spot, but once i did have had no issues. This is something i hope Samsung is able to make improvements on in the future.

I think my Shih Tzu might have been able to create something more tasteful (ah, but I jest, she is merely a dog).Now, for the actual review. This phone is solid. I have dropped it, easily, thirty or more times, and it has yet to break! I was afraid that the pivoting design might be very delicate, but, having owned this phone for nearly four whole months, and having dropped, thrown, and scratched it a whole lot, it is still running strong.The only downside to the hardware is that the back doesn't really seem too well thought out, which is unusual for a Nokia device.Overall, but it, love it, show it to your friends, your mom, and everyone who walks by and says "IS THAT A PHONE?!?!?", and than proceeds to grab your phone and oogle and drool over it. BAM!

Reviews: Help is impossible both on the phone and online. It keeps making notification sounds that mean nothing--or give no reason. It is run by Google on all levels--very irritating. We wanted a simple small phone that could be carried easily and easy to use. I nearly gave up on this one a hundred times and spent weeks trying to make it useable so it wouldn't drive my husband crazy. With no help, I nearly sent this back to Amazon. Finally we got it to receive and send calls without too much trouble. It still makes noises, but my husband ignores it. I don't dare put actual reminders on it, as he would not pay attention to them. It was fairly cheap and fairly small, both of which are hard to find--so we are keeping it until I can find something better. This was my second try to get a useable cell phone for my non-electronics-friendly husband, so I'm really tired of looking.

It only run when it plugged in charger and once pull out charger it keeps showing the restart screen and never turn on. I really like this phone and do not actually want to buy a new iphone or other brand to replace it. But I have no idea what's wrong with that. Hope someone can help!

Reviews: Disappointed - it has all ATT functions on the menus etc. I live overseas and wanted a phone I could use here. I cannot get rid of the ATT functions - I don't care if it's just the basic (calls, texts, etc.) but it has useless GPS, maps, etc. to me that I can't delete?

Product Name: BLU Studio 6.0 Unlocked Cellphone, White
Reviews: I like the big screen because it enables me to read text messages and view pictures effortlessly. The camera excellent and the picture taking process is very easy to navigate. Equally, the battery lasts longer than my previous phone (Samsung Galaxy S). Sometimes, I don't have to charge the battery for a couple of days and it still performs with 70% of its power capacity. The cost of the phone is very reasonable and I was able to get a case for the phone from one of those small phone business stores. The only challenge I have with the phone is the low volume during phone conversations. Also, while scrolling through my contacts, the phone mistakenly dials contacts because it is highly sensitive to touch. Something should be done about that because it keeps calling numbers that you don't intend to call. Other than those two challenges, the phone is a perfect fit for me. I have only used it for three weeks, I hope it lives up to my expectations.

Product Name: Samsung Korea SAMSUNG GALAXY S4 MINI GT-i9195 LTE 8GB- FACTORY UNLOCKED International Version - Unlocked Cell Phones - Retail Packaging - White(NO WARRANTY)
Reviews: verry good

Product Name: OtterBox 77-29864 Defender Series Hybrid Case for Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 - Retail Packaging - White (2012 Version)
Reviews: Works fine; provides good grip when holding. For this price, the tablet should not easily tip over when in the most upright stand position. For iPad versions, the stand grips the corners, but for this Note 10.1 version, there are no corner grips and the stand has holds on each side, about 1/2 inch away from the corners, where the tablet just sits in the grooves with no locking features. This means it tips over easily with too much stylus or finger pressure. There also is no way to set tablet up vertically using the stand provided. There are two horizontal positions only.I've adapted. I brought this because I dropped my first tablet and broke the glass.Just don't think because you're paying $89 bucks you're getting all that you need in a case because you're not. You'll just have to buy based on what's important to you; defense against breakage, having multiple stand positions or integrating a keyboard. Decide before buying a case. This one is primarly for defense againt breakgage only.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy Note 4 N910V - 32GB - Verizon + GSM - White (Certified Refurbished)
Reviews: Perfect phone, new screen. The only bad thing was the S pen was sent with a defective tip. No pressure sensitivity. I had to buy a new pen. The phone was still woth the price I paid for it. If they send me another pen I will rate 5 stars.

Product Name: BLU PURE XL Smartphone - 4G LTE GSM Unlocked - 64GB +3GB RAM - Grey
Reviews: I've had this phone for a few days now and so far, I love it. I had been using two phones, one for work (iPhone) and one for personal use (Samsung Galaxy) and was looking for a dual sim phone so I could stop carrying two phones. This phone has not disappointed. I was able to pop my two sims in and within seconds, I was up and running with one device with two different phone numbers and data plans. All the same apps I was running one my other phones have been installed and are working great. I saw many reviews disappointed in the battery life, but I've had no problems. I'm not a gamer and don't watch a ton of videos, but after a 14 hour work day of "my normal use" which involves a few calls, several text and a lot of time online, I still have around 20% battery at the end of the day. The phone feels like it's well built. The finger print scanner is much faster than my galaxy. I like that I can set the phone to use a specific sim for specific task or allow it to ask me each time. Other phones I've seen only allow you to use one sim at a time. This phone uses both sims at the same time. The screen looks great, the camera is great and it's hands down the fastest between the three phones, You also can't beat the internal storage of 64gb, which you can expand with a microSD. For the already great price you also get two phone covers and the micro USB to USB adapter which would cost you another $100 if you bought separately. So far... very happy with this phone.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy Y GT-S5360t Unlocked GSM Quadband Phone - Grey(International Version No Warranty)
Reviews: I just bought this phone to use as my "travel abroad" phone. I needed a 3G Quadband Unlocked phone so I could pick up inexpensive prepaid voice/data sim cards during my travels and not get clobbered with roaming fees. This phone is perfect. It is inexpensive, has most of the important bells and whistles of Android, and just works. It even runs Netflix streaming, though a bit jerky. Talking GPS works great too. I agree with another reviewer that stated it would be a great alternative to an IPOD touch. Even on WiFi without the sim card installed, the phone pretty much was fully functional (obviously no voice). But the best part of all is the built in tethering feature. You can activate the phone so that the phone can share its data service with other devices (with security and encryption if desired). This was vital for me as I need a "connected" laptop in these out of the way places. I agree with other reviewers' comments about the small screen and more basic nature of the camera. But at the $120 price point, this phone is a steal!A note regarding my seller "Open Group Wireless." I ordered from the Northeast US on Thursday evening and it came in the US mail (FedEX smartpost) Saturday with my regular delivery. The phone appears to be designed for the UK market as the power adapter had the unique UK style plugs. This didn't bother me at all as 1) the package also included a US style converter plug (in the factory sealed box), and 2) the phone uses the now standard MicroUSB style connector. Most cell phones (and Nooks, Kindles, etc.) use this standard. I have tons of these chargers and in the car. They are super cheap an ubiquitous these days anyway. I would also note that the package from Open Group Wireless came with English instructions (though the phone came with default settings of British English, a quick fix) which is consistent with comments from other reviewers and of course the style of power adapter. Also very important, the sealed package came with a 2GB MicroSD card (with full size SD adapter branded by Samsung). Some other reviewers complained about the lack of an included SD card, but mine came with one. Don't know if this is vendor specific.In summary, I could not be happier, especially for the price paid. I hope Samsung keeps making them!

Product Name: Honor 8 Dual Camera Unlocked Phone 64GB - Midnight Black - GSM - US Warranty
Reviews: So far this is the nicest phone I've owned. My second Huawei phone and the quality of their products has only gotten better imo. The design and build quality of this phone makes the jet black iphone look ordinary and the battery life makes the iphone look pathetic. I don't mind the EMUI that much, but am a real fan of Google Now, so went straight to that launcher. The settup was pretty easy, though it did not simply mirror my apps and settings from my other phone, so I had to download and install my favorite apps one at a time. Since the phone is so fast, that did not take much time and it gave me the chance to explore settings and features while I was doing the tasks. Camera results are superb though I have much more to learn about the options and features provided. Signal strength for both wifi and network are the best I've had in my rural local. So far I'm totally pleased with this item and found a case I really like, though I'd much rather use the phone without a case. That is not, however, a practical every day option. Drops could be fatal with so much glass exposed. I'll update more here if I change my point of view, but for now this is a winning choice for my needs and taste.

Product Name: LG G3 D855 16GB (FACTORY UNLOCKED) - No 4G in USA - International Version No Warranty (Gold)
Reviews: First off, I've bought 5 smartphones in the last five months.. It's weird I know. This phone trumps them all, in an odd way. I'll explain. This is not the best feeling phone I've had (the One M7 or the LG G2 would be) and its not the most feature filled phone (Sony Xperia Z1 compact would be)But all around with everything and every area thought about, it is my favorite. The screen on this phone is amazing.. you'll read a ton of reviews on how it's not noticeable or how its not worth the battery drain.. They are all wrong. This screen is absolutely beautiful, and my battery life lasts 2 days with how I use the phone. One thing that is lame about the screen is allot of Apps are not optimized for QHD so for instance my bank app is huge and doesn't fit in the screen, small beans tho on an otherwise perfect screen.The speed is great.. the 801 SoC is crazy fast and the phone never heats up.. At first tho with Lg Health and smart alerts enabled the phone did have noticeable lagg.. that was all fixed with disabling them. You are for sure future-proof for the time being with this SoC and QHD screenThe build is nice.. its sturdy and has a nice weight.. I loved the feel of the G2 though. The G2 wins in the build department but it's stock software was atrocious.. there was even spelling errors all over the place in that mess of a UI. I got a Spigin case and a .2mm ICarez tempered glass screen protector and I enjoy them both.The double tap to turn screen on and off is great and i love the lock-screen knock code.This phone also gets UPDATES DIRECT FROM LG.. so put simply you get the latest version of android right when it's out.. no waiting for Verizon or T-mobile to spend 3 months ruining android. Right when I pulled my phone out of the box it updated to Lollipop 5.0 which is awesome.I will have this phone for a long time.. it has finally stopped my cycle of buying a new phone monthly. I'd recommend it to anyone.. just buy a screen protector (glass) and case quickly because this phone is expensive and it needs both. This varient comes with 2 gigs of system RAM so if thats not enough go with the 32Gig version that has 3 g's of Ram.Love the phone and will never be able to go back to 1080p oh yeah, the camera on this thing is Iphone quality and that's saying something.EDIT 4-2-15: If I could go back and do it all over again I'd get the 32Gig variant of this phone as it has 3 gigabytes of RAM. The 2 gigs in this phone is just not enough to handle this phones specs. I've had to disable all of the cool features I bought the phone for due to the lack of RAM. I'm going to keep this phone as a backup But have ordered a OnePlus One. The OnePlus is an amazingly fast phone and will better suit my needs. If you aren't a power user this version of the G3 should be more than enough. For me sadly, it is not.

Reviews: I got this on a lightening deal for $200 bucks. However, I want to address some claims. Unless you are a very light user you will not get two days off a charge. If you are a heavy user, you might not get one day. I'm a moderate user and typically end the day in the 20%'s, which is good compared to my old iPhone. In spite of reviews, games with a lot of graphics do not play well with this phone, a lot of lag. Angry Birds, Minion Rush, laggy. Camera is a big disappointment, slow to turn on and slow shutter response. Quality is ok, you just never know when you're going to get the picture taken. Other apps all work well without lag. I really like the thinness of the phone and the 5" screen. Audio connected thought Bluetooth is loud. Call quality is ok. Works great with Android Pay.

Product Name: Hipipooo 4 Inch IP68 Waterproof 3G Rugged Android 4.4.2 Smartphone 1.2GHz Quad Core Dual Sim Dustproof Shockproof Capacitive Screen GPS 5MP With NFC-Green
Reviews: This phone is pretty heavy duty as far as it's construction. When you take it out of the box, you will be surprised by it's weight. The phone comes with a screwdriver to unscrew the back to remove it for battery, SIM, and SD card access. Use the rubber corners of the screwdriver to help insert and remove the SIM card. Also, you will need to get an SD card for extra storage since the internal storage is about 1.5 gb. I would definitely recommend this phone to folks who work outdoors i.e. construction, landscaping etc due to it's rugged build and water resistant/waterproof feature. I don't know if anyone else has this issue with their phone but the battery is slightly lose inside so there is a small slide when rotating the phone even when I had already screwed the case backing tightly but it doesn't affect the phone performance by any means.

Product Name: OnePlus 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 64GB Sandstone Black (US Warranty - Model A2005)
Reviews: Amazing phone! I love it and it is just as good as my Moto X Pure Edition (which broke). This is a replacement for my daily driver and I have to say I am truly impressed by OnePlus and how they've managed to put flagship specs on a $300 phone. It is an outstanding phone for the price. The build quality is amazing. The battery is great, so far I've managed to get around 4 hours of screen on time with a fairly dim lit screen, something I was not able to achieve on my MXPE. However, it will depend on how you use your phone and what setting you are comfortable with, nevertheless, the device has outstanding battery, more than enough to last you the day. The only downside, for me at least, is the lack of fast charging. I don't mind it, but it would have been a reasonable addition, considering this is a USB-C device. The USB-C is only convenient for convenience sake. It does not really do all that much to change your experience. Overall, this is a great phone for someone who is looking for low-priced alternative to the MXPE, or other mid-range flagship. I hear the OnePlus 3 does everything this phone does, but it is a hundred dollars more, which is also amazing!

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy Note II N7100 16GB Gray-Unlocked International Phone
Reviews: I originally provided this 5-Star review: Exactly as advertised. I was able to purchase a tracfone micro-sim card and the phone works flawlessly. I also upgraded with a 64GB memory card and it works great. This was my original opinionHOWEVER...THEN The 3.5mm headphone jack quit working. The sound was very distorted. I looked on line on how I could fix it and was recommended to use an alcohol wipe with a straightened paperclip to clean the 3.5mm port. I did this an it worked...FOR A SHORT TIME. I thought I had somehow allowed dirt/grime/whatever to get into this jack. But the second time it quit working I was listening to it, Was working fine, then it just went out. Exact same distorted sound issue. I tried cleaning it, with no luck. I have found no way to fix this. Also, there is absolutely no support for an international Samsung phone.A phone without the ability to get sound out of a 3.5mm jack is ALMOST USELESS. Sure, I can use a blue tooth headset for calls and a blue tooth speaker for sound, but that isn't allowed on an airplane. All other functions work, just not the 3.5mm headphone jack. So I am downgrading my previous 5-star to a 2-Star with the warning: DO NOT BUY THE INTERNATIONAL VERSION OF THIS PHONE!

Now, the screen size is a plus, very clear but some times get unresponsive, the speakers for talking are great but to listen music not that great. And the reason I give a 3 stars is the battery, very poor performance, the meter tells you: you have one day of power and in reality last around 3+ hours. for me its a great phone but the battery bad performance over lap the other great features of the phone. If you are into internet, videos, games and music I wont recommend it for the lack of power in battery, if only use for calling, texting, taking pictures in other words, just the basic. then its ok for you.

Reviews: My recent purchase was supposed to be an unlocked android, however, upon receiving the item, it turns out it was not unlocked. My contacts did not show up in my phonebook and my internet data did not work. I emailed them according to the email address they gave me, and they were not able to help me nor were they trying to find a way to help me. I tried contacting the number they gave me several times, however, I seemed to have always reached them "AFTER their business hours", when I called at 10/11AM and their business hours are supposedly Monday-Friday 9AM-5PM. I am very upset and am filing a z claim.

Product Name: Microsoft Lumia 950 XL RM-1085 32GB Black, Single Sim, 5.7", 20MP, 3GB Ram, Unlocked International Model, No Warranty
Reviews: This is one of my very few reviews on amazon. As a former android user and a college student, Window phone is great. android is great too, but the apps can be overwhelming sometimes...this is really helping me manage my time well. 950xl is great in most areas you need it for. Most of the apps you might need are available. If you're entrenched in google's ecosystem like I am it can be a little hard, but you'll get used to it. I like W10, its fluid. No lagging whatsoever, the battery is great a single charge throughout the day, the back camera is good, but the selfie cam is not the best, and the display is beautiful. The phone is customizable to a good degree, I haven't figured it all out. It has the S7 glance screen, it has LG's knock knock feature, the iris scanner is on point, even in dark spaces it recognise my iris, Cortana reads your text if you have Bluetooth headphone on, this comes in handy when I'm biking ...apps like camscanner and mystudylife and lots of other useful app is in the store. The US states and other country's map can be downloaded for offline navigation, but only driving and walking navigation, New York's MTA map is not there, ( I'm a lil sour about that since I mostly take the train). there are many more features, In my opinion, if you really want to spend less time on unnecessary apps, but take note, set reminders/calendars text and call, play a few games and listen to music. this is a great phone.P.S: I've had it for a month now.I have a small android tablet for my bank apps and some other apps for conveniency...and khan academy

Microsoft Lumia 950 XL RM-1085 32GB White, Single Sim, 5.7", 20MP, 3GB Ram, Unlocked International Model, No Warranty
Reviews: I was very skeptical as to the reliability and quality of a phone that I found $130 cheaper on Amazon than it was on the actual Microsoft website. Then I actually got it. It's the real thing, lol. It's the international version which only comes with one SIM slot and a power adapted for use in the US. The phone itself feels premium, this coming from using an iPhone for the last 2 years. The hardware is there (has a great camera and screen) and it has some neat features (iris recognition to unlock your phone, when connected to your car via Bluetooth Cortana is very helpful and lets you speech to text respond to the person who just texted you easily), the only reason its not getting 5 stars is because the software and App support is still... sadly, lacking. Apps just don't look good like they do on IOS or Android and lack features that the other competitors have. Maybe in the next few months Microsoft can fix this and improve bugs. In the meantime, its a fun and powerful phone for what it is able to do. It's cheaper on here than on the official website but comes with no warranty. I have no hardware problems as of the moment so I say it was worth it.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy S5 SM-G900A GSM Unlocked Cellphone, 16GB, Blue
Reviews: I wanted to buy a "new" unlocked phone that would work on the AT&T network here in Alaska. I did a lot of research to ensure this model would work best on their network. It appears that most/ (maybe all) GSM phones with work world-wide on other GSM networks. However, from my research, it seems as though not every GSM phone will with perform as well as the "branded" models that are designed for use on their networks. This appears to especially hold true for what data speed you can potentially connect with i.e., 3G maximum or 4G LTE service.I ordered a new phone and that is exactly what I got. It still had the protective film over all the ports, etc. and the phone clock only had a few minutes of QC test-time on it. It came with a battery, wall charger, ear-buds and instructions. I did have to go to the AT&T store to have them install a micro-SIM because my old phone used the mini-SIM so I could not simply swap it out between the two phones.Overall this a very nice high-end phone. Fast, with a crisp & clear screen. Seems to be working fine on my network and it connects to the LTE signals when I'm in range of those cell towers.

Product Name: LG Nexus 5X Unlocked Smart Phone, 5.2" Quartz White, 32GB Storage, US Warranty
Reviews: Best, and cheapest, phone I've ever had.Its not "top of the line" yet has the best image quality of any android phone I've owned so far. (Not DSLR quality, but still) has NFC which means I can use Android Pay, and a fingerprint button.It may not be top of the line. It may not be the biggest. (which honestly, why would a smaller phone be worse than a larger phone anyway) It may not have the fastest processor. AND... It may not have the most RAM. But the phone does everything I want it to and seems to manage its RAM usage perfectly so I don't have to worry with the RAM...And, to top it all off, I get monthly updates. With the fragmented android ecosystem, I used to root/flash custom roms to get the latest firmware. Nexus devices, like this, solve that problem. (and I can still use Android Pay which I cant do on a custom ROM)

It's priced under a mortgage payment and after using and holding it, I'm not sure why someone would spend $600 - $800 on something else of similar or lesser quality (Apple).The screen is nice and large, it runs very smoothly and efficiently (compared to what I'm used to), and it has a really nice camera. I'll be buying another one to replace my fiances equally aged S3. The only thing I see potentially wrong with the purchase so far is that mine did not come with headphones, which is not that big of a deal, but there was clearly a space for them in the package and there was nothing there. Not sure if that's just crappy quality control or if these just simply don't include headphones.

Product Name: Nokia E7-00 Unlocked GSM Phone with Touchscreen, QWERTY Keyboard, Easy E-mail Setup, GPS Navigation, 8 MP Camera--U.S. Version with Warranty (Silver)
Reviews: As a user of the N8 for some time I have become frustrated with its small screen; 3.5 inches just does not cut it anymore for a high priced touchscreen device. So I bit the bullet and ordered the E7. Let me tell you up front it is a very attractive design with a stunning screen viewable outside even with the brightness set on low; many times i have been astounded by the wonderful visibility of its Clear Black AMOLED Display and the 4 inch screen makes a big difference for me in comfort and usability.I do not want to waste time rehashing info clearly described in other reviews so lets get to the meat of the situation:1 -If you take any type of up close / macro shots on a regular basis you will be terribly disappointed. The camera is just not good for that type of imagery. All other photography is great in most well lit situations even with out great lighting you can get decent shots.2 - The Wifi is quite finicky on these phones so you maybe reconnecting a bit (OK, a lot!). I thought it was just my unit but it seems many users are having this issue. It's not bad enough for me to not want to use the phone but it might be for you.Nokia really screwed the pooch on this magnificent phone; just adding a 5mp auto focus camera would have been sufficient and not cannibalized the N8 sales. The Wifi issue is not that big for me and could probably be easily resolved with firmware.I am writing this for people who already know about the Symbian OS and understand its strengths and limitations. I believe Symbian Belle is a very good OS and a pleasure to use; Iphone and Android zombies might not be appreciative of any Symbian phone regardless.

Product Name: POSH Titan HD E500a - 5.0" HD, 4G, Android 4.4 Kit Kat, Octa-core, 8GB , 13MP Camera, Ultra Slim, Dual Sim Smartphone (Black)
Reviews: I was really happy when i got this phone. It was better than i expected and for the price, i really thought i got way more than i bargained for.After a little over 2 weeks, i started noticing that the phone went from about 50% battery power to empty.it didn't happen daily so i was ready to completely ignore it because of how great the phone was despite the "power failures" until yesterday when i was on the way to picking up a client and got a bit lost.So, checking my phone, i was sure i had 67% battery power so i used google maps to take me to the meeting place and the problem struck right then and there. Long story short, i got in a bit of trouble because of my phone's unreliable battery power indicator.Overall, this is a great android phone and for the price it's an awesome deal if only the battery indicator wasn't that unreliable.I should give it three stars really, but taking yesterday's incident that could have cost me my livelihood made me decide on one star as i don't want anyone getting in trouble because of the phone's unreliability.

Product Name: POSH MOBILE TITAN PRO HD ANDROID GSM UNLOCKED DUAL SIM 5.5" HD SMARTPHONE EXTRA-large HD display, 13MP Camera and 8GB of Storage. 1 Year warranty. (Model#: E550 NAVY BLUE)
Reviews: I ordered a new phone and they sent me a re-furbished one.The ring level is too low so I miss 1/2 the calls. The ringer cannot be set for individual callers (such as my wife so I never miss that call).The hands free speaker is not capable of picking up my voice so can't do direct hands free.That alarm has the most terrible wake up music and instead of gentle waking you, it jolts you awake and although there are choices they are all not suitable. You have to wake up to set the doze button. the minimum alarm you can set is 5 minutes.The worst part is that the phone keeps making a small ding sound telling me the phone has some message . . . which usually is some program that wants to read my e-mails, my contacts or my location. The phone will not tell me which program it is nor can I set a different tone for each program.Want to go crazy? The time is always one hour ahead when roaming and no way to correct it! I did try to change GMT and set it for the cell provider time but neither worked.The camera is workable as long as a flash is not needed. The flash is not coordinated with the shutter so all flash pictures are very dark and not usable. There is no picture stabilization so many pictures come out blurred.

Product Name: Samsung Galaxy Exhibit 4G (T-Mobile), t679
Reviews: This is my first smart phone and I was lured in by the reasonable price and T-Mobile's new $30 unlimited text, unlimited data, 100 minutes plan. I simply could not justify the expense of phone and data before. I think this phone is great value for $200. It has almost every feature I want. The only thing I would have really liked would be a 5mp camera like on the Galaxy S. I handled a Galaxy S and was considering buying a refurbished one of those for $150 more before deciding on the Exhibit II. I don't regret saving the money. Unless you've had a higher quality phone before, or you're comparing this side-by-side with something higher end, you won't feel limited or cheated by this phone. It's got a very crisp vibrant display, runs quick and smooth, and even with the 3.2mp camera I've taken some decent photos. Sure beats my previous phone anyway. Battery easily lasts me from 6am to late in the night. I haven't had it actually die on me yet. I don't know how my usage might compare to others, but I use Facebook and email frequently throughout the day, have tried out the GPS navigation a couple of times, used Google Music, surfed a bit of news, and played Words With Friends. The display is the biggest battery drain I think, so I keep that down pretty low all the time. I don't do much talking, hence getting the plan with only 100 minutes, so I can't say how much battery is affected by talk time.Only a couple of gripes... As others have mentioned, the beep when the battery is charged is annoying. I charge my phone by my bed at night and I still want to be able to receive emergency calls and texts so I'm not going to put it on silent in order to avoid that beep. But it does wake me up. Still, I can live with it.Sometimes texts fail to send and I've seen other people in forums with this problem too. Also the texting app is glitchy and doesn't always respond to your taps in the text area to bring up the keyboard.Yes, the back cover is as slippery as everyone else says. I bought the gel skin case for the Galaxy W (same phone as the Exhibit II, just rebranded outside the US) and I'm so glad I did. I would certainly have dropped the phone repeatedly by now if I didn't have the skin.Overall, I highly recommend this phone. Excellent price for $200, especially if you're been holding out for a while for the price of smart phones and data plans to drop.

Product Name: BLU PURE XL Smartphone - 4G LTE GSM Unlocked - 64GB +3GB RAM - Grey
Reviews: BLU PURE XL Smartphone - 4G LTE GSM Unlocked - 64GB +3GB RAM - GreyThe BLU Pure XL is amazing, very fast speed and amazing screen detail. The camera it amazing but does make pictures very bright, low light is fantastic and focus is fast and sharp, you get way more than what you pay for.Speakers: The dual stereo speakers are loud and clear. I have to turn the phone down in order to make my ringer not be heard by the neighbors.Screen: Screen is full 1440 and the refresh rate is high end. While watching videos you'll be able to see pores on faces just fine and very fluid movement.1 Handed Ability: The Built-In keyboard is great but swipe prediction is very pore. This does have very good one handed support. But I recommend replacing the Keyboard app with something that has better prediction if you're a swipe user.Network: Although this phone has LTE bands built in; the older bands that most companies offer in little to smaller areas are not supported. This phone is made with the newer bands that most companies are upgrading towers to provide. So if someone does get this phone and the newer band is not in your area you'll have either H+ or 4G (refer below). Not to worry all the cell companies are working on the upgrades and the LTE bands will become available in your area soon. Refer to your provider for further information. As of now LTE is supported on this phone in most cities, towns, and urban areas depending on service. I recommend a service sunning on AT&T towers. Until T-Mobile finishes upgrades on towers, LTE is very limited and may continue to be limited due to no support for Band 12. (Although there is band 4 which is T-Mobiles dominate.)Note: This phone was said to be getting Marshmallow but for now we have a stock version of Lollipop. No set date has been announced for the update.1. E = EDGE/GSM: When getting this sign you are getting the weakest signal for your phone but are still getting non-roaming signal for general calls and text. I advise if this is your areas mane signal strength you have a Wi-Fi signal available for the data internet connection.2. G = 2G/GSM: When the G is showing you are getting remedial signal but still pretty strong. Calls and Text's will be flawless and you will be able to do general internet surfing but you will not be loading any HD videos or have perfect connection to online only game's. With this I recommend a Wi-Fi signal in your house if you plan on using the internet in these areas.3. H = 3G-/HSPA: This signal is classified as 3G but runs a little slower or faster depending on how close you are to the main tower. If you're getting a good amount of bars with signal will do flawless calls, text's, and you'll be able to able to surf the internet and load videos at a max of 480P (320 Resolution is recommend for best result).4. 3G = 3G+/GSM/HSPA: This is the full 3G speed and will be flawless with calls, text's, and be able to stream video like Netflix and Hulu (Recommended 480 Resolution), play online games, and surf the internet fast and easy.5. H+ = 4G-/GSM/HSPA+: This is the signal that most first generation 4G phones use. Perfect for all light movie watchers, and small business people. Flawless calls, text's, and the internet is speedy. H+ although fast has been known to be faulty in a lot of area's and was quickly replaced. If you've got this signal it's still 4G but it's kind of like the EGDE version of 4G. For best results stay in one place when in use as service changes rapidly while moving from place to place. Example using this speed while driving would not be reliable.6. 4G = 4G/GSM/HSPA+: This is the 4G signal that was most used from 2010 to 2012 4G phones use such as the Galaxy S series (Sept for the S4) Although this is a very fast and reliable; it's not as fast as LTE in most areas but for the average person whom just watched movies and plays online games on his/her phone this signal is more than enough to give anyone a crisp fast feel and load HD movies (720P Recommended but not limited to.)7. 4G LTE = 4G+/GSM/LTE: This is the current signal most used. It is lighting fast and is the most reliable for non-stop videos, gaming, and downloading.Disclaimer about BLU Phones: Most BLU Phones are made to have a long shelf like as they are not ready to sell from a store. As such the Battery has never had a full charge. I recommend before turning the phone on to charge it for a full 8 to 12 hours and not to unplug it even if it says full. If you turn the phones on before they are charged fully you risk losing battery memory and suffering pore battery life.NOTICE: Most BLU phones to not auto populate Access Point Names (APN) and in turn when someone puts in the SIM card the service seems to not work or some people will start having issues with picture messaging. Google search your provider for correct APN settings and install them in the phone yourself. This is an issue with most unlocked phones and is very easy to fix.

Product Name: verykool SL5550 Maverick LTE 5.5" 4G LTE Unlocked GSM Smartphone (black)
Reviews: Got this phone because I was going to be traveling internationally and wanted a dual-SIM phone. Had it in the US for a few weeks at first and it was fine. US cell carrier found it a bit challenging to set up (had to call them) but then it worked OK.Got a local SIM card at the airport when I arrived overseas.Was impressed at the size of the battery compared to the size of the phone and figured it would last well. No so. At first what seemed like normal use would deplete the battery in less than a day. Then got careful about turning off features I wasn't using at the time and re-charging at odd times when convenient and now happy enough with it. In group I'm traveling with I'm usually the one with charge left on her phone when it's time to call a cab in the evening. Have a small external battery pack, too, just in case, too.I really do not like the camera - the quality of the images are way below the middle-of-the-road Motorola phone I had before. I shoot at highest resolution and have attempted to adjust ISO, etc. for conditions. Still, the pics often look muddy and taking them is a real pain because you have to touch in the exact center of the shutter (iris image) button. Missed a lot of shots at first from that.Came with a plastic screen protector (I did not use- got a glass one that Almost fits...) and a plastic case/cover for the back of the phone, which I do use. Problem with the case/cover is the holes for the charger and headset are wrong and I have to pull the case/cover off the top of the phone to fully plug in charger or headset.Performance seems OK. Screen looks great. Like the 16 GB memory standard and the option of adding an SD card.We'll see how it works when I'm back in the States. One friend with a verykool never did get the data to work properly when returning to the US.
